exercise.content: The first written records for the history of France appeared in the <key_1> Age. What is now France made up the bulk of the region known to the Romans as <key_2>. The Gauls, the largest group, were Celtic people speaking <key_3>. The Roman Republic annexed southern Gaul in the late <key_4> century BC, and legions under Julius Caesar conquered the rest of Gaul in the Gallic Wars of <key_5>â€“51 BC. A Gallo-Roman culture emerged and Gaul was increasingly integrated into the <key_6> Empire.
